FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
This anhydrous ammonia facility , is located on a farmstead 1(one) mile east of Ackley, Iowa and complies with American National Safety Requirements for the storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, with exception stated in the Iowa Fertilizer Law.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the local emergency 911 representatives including the local police, Ackley Fire Department and the Hardin County LEPC.  641-858-3822. 

 Our worst case scenario if failure of a 12,000 gallon storage tank and/or two 6000 gal tanks when filled to the greatest amount allowed, resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.
  
The general accident release prevention program and the chemical-specific prevention steps. This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state nd local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with state law by certified and experienced workmen. 

Five year accident history.  We have never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage.
 
The emergency response program. In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is our policy to notify the Ackley Police Department, Ackley Fire Department and the Hardin County LEPC..  We have discussed our system with the local emergency services and they have inspected our anhydrous system. 

Planned changes to improve safety.  We are having the tank repainted in August or September including proper painting of the valves and replacement of placards. 

SAFETY INFORMATION:      We maintain information on safe storage and handling anhydrous ammonia,      Maintain equipment specification for all equipment.  Document SOP for the operation of the equipment.
   
HAZARD REVIEW:        Use an industry standard checklist currently use Exhibit 6 A-4 from t

he RMP workshop.  We also maintain the hazard review conducted by the Department of Agriculture State of Iowa..

 OPERATING PROCEDURE:     Implemented employee training program   Program complies with all government and industry standards.  Complete written operational procedures.

 TRAINING:      Implemented a safety program.   All employees handling product will be tested annually.  With refresher training done on an annual basis..

  MAINTENANCE:     Maintain the on-going mechanical integrity of the tank.   We currently have a maintenance inspection checklist obtained from the RMP workshop.  The schedule for inspection and testing of equipment will be done annually and we will document all inspections. 

 COMPLIANCE AUDITS:     J. M. Hunt & Son will conduct and document compliance audits every three years.  We will send a report on the audits findings with a proper response to each finding.  We will also document corrected deficiencies.   J. M . Hunt & Son will maintain compliance audit reports for five years.
                        
                                                                                 Merle W. Hunt
